meanings.definition: The belief in only one god.
meanings.sent1: Monotheism is the idea that there is just one god.
meanings.sent2: Many people around the world follow monotheism, believing in a single deity.
meanings.sent3: At the monotheism convention, only one god showed up!
meanings.sent4: In a world of many beliefs, monotheism stands out like a lone star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monotheism can be as powerful as a beam of light cutting through darkness.

meanings.definition: The doctrine or belief that there is only one God.
meanings.sent1: Monotheism teaches that there is only one God to worship.
meanings.sent2: The monotheism of Christianity, Islam, and Judaism sets them apart from polytheistic religions.
meanings.sent3: The monotheism debate at the dinner table got heated when someone suggested multiple gods.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of noise, monotheism is like a single clear note that rings true.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of monotheism can be a guiding light in a complex world.
